comments:
Sometimes, I get the following internal error when I try to synchronize with 
the cvs repository:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at

sion(RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.java:578)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.access$8
(RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.java:576)
	at

us(RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.java:526)

(StatusListener.java:51)

(Command.java:471)

evisions(RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.java:537)

	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.buildRemot
eTree(RemoteFolderTreeBuilder.java:149)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.CVSWorkspaceRoot.getRemoteSyncTree
(CVSWorkspaceRoot.java:112)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.sync.CVSSyncCompareInput.createSyncElements
(CVSSyncCompareInput.java:52)
	at org.eclipse.team.ui.sync.SyncCompareInput.prepareInput
(SyncCompareInput.java:200)
	at org.eclipse.compare.CompareEditorInput.run
(CompareEditorInput.java:294)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:98)


I am not sure what causes it to occur, but if it happens, it keeps reoccuring 
until I choose Team-->Update on my project. After an update, synchronize works 
again.

I get the same error when I want to synchronize for the first time after I 
checked out a project from the repository. But here the error occurs always 
when I want to synchroize and the workaround (Team --> Update) doesn't work.

I just got it again today, when another guy had deleted some directories and 
files from cvs.
When it happened, I switched to the cmdline, and got the following output from 
running "cvs -n update *"

--
protocol error: 
directory '/ibankbank/src/dk/nykredit/product/ibank/bank/business/service' not 
within root 's:/Dsource'
--

Running Team-->Update again fixed it, any idea what is wrong ?

What version of CVSNT server are you running against?

One thing to try is to enter your repository path as S:\Dsource instead of 
S:/Dsource.

I am using v1.11.1 of the cvsnt server.

I'll give it a try to change from s:/dsource to s:\dsource - what should that 
change ?
*** Bug 12411 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I am so far unable to reproduce. Is this still happening for anybody?

I haven't seen it in a while - still using s:/dsource instead of s:\dsource 
though.

Yes, I am still getting the error (20020321).

We are using 1.11.1p1 on a Linux server and getting the error on both Linux and 
Windows clients. Performing an update fixes the problem.

Our repository path is /home/duke/REMOTECVS

Regards, Ilja

Is there anything special about your setup? For instance, do you just unzip 
eclipse and run it or do you use -data. Is your workspace on your local drive 
or a network drive. Do you pre-create your projects and then checkout into them 
(so you have a java nature)? Basically, this PR doesn't happen very often so 
any information about how your setup may differ from the usual would be helpful.

We do have a central mixed (Linux + Windows) installation on a Linux server.

On Windows clients, Eclipse is started using

start %DUKE_HOME%\EVAL\ECLIPSE\eclipse.exe -data %ECLIPSE_WORKSPACE% -vmargs -
Xbootclasspath/a:%JAVA_HOME%/lib/tools.jar

in a batch file.

The Linux shell script to start Eclipse uses the line

$JAVA -Xmx256M -classpath $ECLIPSE_HOME/startup.jar 
org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -data $HOME/ECLIPSE -plugins 
$ECLIPSE_HOME/plugins -ws motif -application org.eclipse.ui.workbench

As far as I can tell, the problem occurs both using local and network 
workspaces. Eclipse .project and .classpath are checked into CVS, so that 
simply checking out a project will create the correct nature.

This seems to occur only for cvsnt.  It works fine for the unix pserver.  All 
versions of cvsnt are affected.

Initially, when you add a project from cvs via "checkout as project" right-
click option in the repositories view, the project folder is created but 
nothing else is checked out.

If I check out the project via WinCVS, eclipse seems to work after that, 
assuming that you have a corresponding repository defined in WinCVS and 
eclipse.

Antonio,

for me your problem seems to be more or less unrelated to this bug. Probably 
you should open a new one.

Just wanted to let you know that the problem is still there in M5:

Does performing an Update fix the problem?
Yes, performing an update fixes the problem.

Is there any pattern associated with when it occurs (e.g. incomming change on a 
file, outgoing change, new file or folder, etc.)

I have seen it mostly when other people have created new folders, and deleted 
others - usually during refactoring.

The NPE has been fixed. An error along the line of "An error has occured 
processing file ..." will be generated. If you see this error in the future, 
please open a bug report.
*** Bug 14339 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I found and fixed the probable cause of this.
